member.name: T:Telerik.Reporting.Services.WebApi.CacheFactory
member.summary: Creates different built-in cache implementations.
member.remarks: This class is now obsolete. Please use instead.

member.name: M:Telerik.Reporting.Services.WebApi.CacheFactory.CreateFileCache
member.summary: Creates a new instance of file cache in a temp folder that will store cached data.

member.name: M:Telerik.Reporting.Services.WebApi.CacheFactory.CreateFileCache(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of file cache that will store cached data in a directory of the file system.
member.param: The directory path that will be used from the cache as repository.

member.name: M:Telerik.Reporting.Services.WebApi.CacheFactory.CreateDatabaseCache(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Creates new instance of database cache that will store cached data in a database.
member.param: Specifies which database engine should be used.
A connection string that should be used to connect to the cache database
member.remarks:
In order to use a database cache you should firstly use the Database Cache Configuration Tool in order to create the underplaying database and its schema.
Note that the database cache implementation relies on the Telerik OpenAccess so the following OpenAccess core libraries should be referenced: Telerik.OpenAccess.dll, Telerik.OpenAccess.35.Extensions.dll . Proper assembly binding redirects might apply.
See also: Configuring the Database Cache Provider

member.name: M:Telerik.Reporting.Services.WebApi.ReportsControllerBase.CreateReportResolver
member.summary: Creates an implementation instance that will be used for report resolving from the service
member.remarks: Override this method in order to create the report resolver instance. May be one of the built-in report resolvers or a custom implementation resolver. Built-in resolvers may be chained.

member.name: M:Telerik.Reporting.Services.WebApi.ReportsControllerBase.CreateCache
member.summary: Creates an implementation instance that will be used for internal storage from the service.
member.remarks: Override this method in order to create the cache instance. May be one of the built-in caching implementations or a custom implementation. To use one of the built-in caching implementations use the class.
member.returns: An instance of cache that will be used from the controller in order to preserve its cache/state.

member.name: M:Telerik.Reporting.Services.WebApi.ReportsControllerBase.CreateStorage
member.summary: Creates an implementation instance that will be used for internal storage from the service.
member.remarks: Override this method in order to create the storage instance. May be one of the built-in storage implementations or a custom implementation.
member.returns: An instance of storage that will be used from the controller in order to preserve its cache/state.

member.name: M:Telerik.Reporting.Services.WebApi.ReportsControllerBase.CreateErrorResponse(System.Net.HttpStatusCode,System.String)
member.summary: Creates error response to be sent to the client

member.name: M:Telerik.Reporting.Services.WebApi.ReportsControllerBase.GetUserIdentity
member.summary: Override this method to substitute the default retrieval logic, which uses System.Web.HttpContext.Current.User.Identity
member.returns: The UserIdentity object instance, that can be later retrieved by property or by using expression =UserIdentity

member.name: P:Telerik.Reporting.Services.WebApi.ReportsControllerBase.ReportServiceConfiguration
member.summary: Gets or sets the configuration of the report service.
member.remarks: When inheriting the ReportsControllerBase controller basic configuration is needed. Provide an object implementing the in order to configure the report service. This should be done in the controllers' constructor using static object to preserve the configuration between requests or using dependency injection.
member.example:
This example shows how to configure WebAPI service using dependency injection.
1. Setup method registering the configuration object in a dependency injection container. The example uses the Unity container.
Example based on the article Dependency Injection in ASP.NET Web API 2
2. ReportsController implementation
3. Invoke the setup in the Application_Start method

member.name: T:Telerik.Reporting.Services.WebApi.ClientReportSource
member.summary: Represents a report source passed to the ReportsControllerBase from its clients.

member.name: P:Telerik.Reporting.Services.WebApi.ClientReportSource.Report
member.summary: Gets or sets a string representation of a report document reference

member.name: P:Telerik.Reporting.Services.WebApi.ClientReportSource.ParameterValues

member.remarks: Applicable only when BaseDocumentID is provided.

member.name: T:Telerik.Reporting.Services.WebApi.ReportsControllerConfiguration
member.summary: Represents the report controller configuration.

member.name: M:Telerik.Reporting.Services.WebApi.ReportsControllerConfiguration.RegisterRoutes(System.Web.Http.HttpConfiguration)
member.summary: Registers report controller's routes in the application configuration.
member.param: The application configuration to add the routes to
member.remarks: Registers report controller's routes with the default "api" first path segment.

member.name: M:Telerik.Reporting.Services.WebApi.ReportsControllerConfiguration.RegisterRoutes(System.Web.Http.HttpConfiguration,System.String)
member.summary: Registers report controller's routes in the application configuration.
member.param: The application configuration to add the routes to

The first path segment to include in the route template. For example, "api" is the default literal path segment in the "api/{controller}" route template. Use this overload and pass a unique path segment (e.g. "reportingapi") to avoid collisions with other Web API services. Then modify the report viewer client to use the custom service URL address.

member.summary: Raises the exception event.
member.param: The context for the action.
